cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (100 km) E of Varadero, Cuba and 145 mi (235 km) SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Irma is forecast to turn northwest later today and then north-northwest on Sunday, tracking up the Florida Keys early Sunday and paralleling/coming ashore along Florida’s southwest coast before moving inland toward north-central Florida and the southeastern United States.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from north of the Volusia/Brevard County line to Isle of Palms, South Carolina; Hurricane Watch north of Fernandina Beach to Edisto Beach, South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to the Aucilla River; Storm Surge Warning from the Volusia/Brevard County line southward around the peninsula to the Suwanee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially the west coast, with significant impacts also expected along the northeast Florida and southeast Georgia coasts including Jacksonville
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely at Jacksonville Monday with a 47 % chance of reaching 50 kt (58 mph); brief hurricane-force gusts are possible as the center passes west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 2–4 ft of surge above ground along the St. Johns River and the Atlantic beaches near Jacksonville, especially around high tide Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with isolated totals near 20 inches could cause flash flooding in the Jacksonville area Monday into early Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and dangerous surf/rip currents along the northeast Florida coast.
